results.name: Largest prime factor of 2^n + 1.
comment: a(n) != 1 (mod n) for n = 3, 51, 141, 309, 321, 348, ... - _Giovanni Resta_ & _Thomas Ordowski_, Jan 05 2014
a(n) != 1 (mod n) iff a(m) = a(n) for some m < n. Then n = 3m for m = 1, 17, 47, 103, 107, 116, ... - _Thomas Ordowski_, Jan 08 2014

formula: Charles proves that a(n) >> n^(4/3) infinitely often under the abc conjecture, and reports that Andrew Granville has improved this to a(n) >> n^2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 29 2013
